option_value:
a:2:{s:7:"subject";s:49:"CC Global Network Membership Application Approved";s:7:"message";s:2922:" Application Approved

Dear *|APPLICANT_NAME|*,

Congratulations! Your application to join the Creative Commons Global Network has been approved. Welcome to the Network!

What to do next? You may:

  1. Log in to the Network website and edit your profile here –
    *|APPLICANT_PROFILE_URL|*
    From now on, your profile is now visible to other members of the Global Network, and your username and areas of interest can be seen by any visitor to the site. You can check out your profile and update it as you like! Once logged in, you will be able to see details of other members of the network and their interests.
  2. Join Creative Commons on Slack and introduce yourself! We use Slack as our main contact point with our wider community, including members of the Network.

Your CC Chapter: Once logged in, on the Global Network page, you can search and contact members of the Network based in your country . This will allow you to contact them and start preparing the first Chapter meeting in advance with others. You don't know about CC Chapters? Check this out.

Every member of the Network agrees to abide by the Global Network Charter, including the Code of Conduct and the referenced policies. This means if you violate its terms, your membership in the CCGN may terminate in the discretion of Creative Commons. Please be sure you are aware of your obligations and commitments as stated in the Global Network Charter.

Your membership is valid for two years. You will need to reapply every two years. Don't worry, we will remind you to renew your membership.

If you have any questions or concerns about this process, we are happy to help you by email at network-support@creativecommons.org. Or you can always check the updated documentation in our Github page.

Thank you for your support of the CC Global Network.

– Creative Commons

";}

a:2:{s:6:"prefix";s:26:"CC Global Network Message:";s:7:"wrapper";s:797:" Creative Commons Global Network Chapter Message

*|MESSAGE|*

This message has been sent to you based on the interest you have expressed in joining one of the Network's national Chapters. If you do not wish to receive further communications do not respond to this email, and clear the chapter setting on your Global Network account. If you have any questions or concerns about this message, we are happy to help you by email at network-support@creativecommons.org.

";}

a:2:{s:7:"subject";s:88:"CC Global Network Institutional Membership Application Being Processed By Our Legal Team";s:7:"message";s:1093:" Application Received

Dear *|APPLICANT_NAME|* –

The next stage of your institution's Creative Commons Global Network membership application requires our legal team to be in touch. This is standard for every institutional application.

They'll be in touch as soon as possible.

If you have any questions or concerns about this process, we are happy to help you by email at network-support@creativecommons.org. Or you can always check the updated documentation in our Github page or on the Network page.

Thank you for your support of the CC Global Network.

– Creative Commons

";}

a:2:{s:7:"subject";s:61:"A New Institutional Network Applicant Requires Your Attention";s:7:"message";s:414:"Hi CC Legal team! *|APPLICANT_NAME|* has been approved by the network council and now requires your attention. You can see the application page here - *|SITE_URL|*/wp-admin/admin.php?page=global-network-application&user_id=*|APPLICANT_ID|* This is an automated message from the Network site. Beep.";}

a:2:{s:7:"subject";s:49:"CC Global Network Membership Application Received";s:7:"message";s:2411:" Application Received

Dear *|APPLICANT_NAME|* –

Thanks so much for your application!

What’s next?

The next step is that your application will be reviewed by the two people you asked to vouch for you. Expect a response from us informing you of the status of your application. This whole process can take some days, please be patient until we get back in contact with you.

In the meantime, remember you can always participate in any of our Network Platforms even before becoming a member of the Network. An easy way to be in contact with all the activities and conversations happening within our broader network is to join us on Slack.

Remember to read the Network Charter carefully. A reminder that by applying and accepting our Terms of Service and the terms of our Privacy Policy, you have consented to allow Creative Commons to send your personal information to the vouchers and to the members of the Interim Membership Council that has final decision making authority with respect to your application. See our Privacy Policy for more information about where your information will be sent.

If you have any questions or concerns about this process, we are happy to help you by email at network-support@creativecommons.org. Or you can always check the updated documentation in our Github page or on the Network page.

Thank you for your support of the CC Global Network.

– Creative Commons

";}

a:2:{s:7:"subject";s:49:"CC Global Network Membership Application Declined";s:7:"message";s:1671:" Application Declined

Dear *|APPLICANT_NAME|* –

We regret to have to inform you that your application to join the Creative Commons Global Network has been declined.

For confidentiality reasons we cannot discuss the deliberation process and details of the review process of individual applications, including with the applicant. It may be possible for you to apply in the future with different vouchers and a different profile.

Our Privacy Policy provides that you may access and correct any personal information that Creative Commons may have. If you believe that Creative Commons may have incorrect personal information about you, collected either through your application or through the voucher(s), please email Creative Commons at legal@creativecommons.org. Creative Commons will only retain such information for 21 days from the time your application was declined, after which your personal information related to your application will be deleted.

If you have any questions or concerns about this process, we are happy to help you by email at network-support@creativecommons.org, but we are limited in what we can discuss about your particular application.

– Creative Commons

";}

a:2:{s:7:"subject";s:35:"CC Global Network - Action Required";s:7:"message";s:1044:" Application Update Required

Dear *|APPLICANT_NAME|* –

Before we can evaluate your application to join the Creative Commons Global Network, we need just a few more details.

*|NOTE|*

You can update your application details by following this link:

*|APPLICATION_FORM_URL|*

Once you've updated your application details, we will start evaluating it.

If you have any questions or concerns about this process, we are happy to help you by email at network-support@creativecommons.org, but we are limited in what we can discuss about your particular application.

– Creative Commons

";}

a:2:{s:7:"subject";s:34:"CC Global Network Vouching Request";s:7:"message";s:3976:" Vouching Request

Hi *|VOUCHER_NAME|* –

We have received an application from *|APPLICANT_NAME|* to join the Creative Commons Global Network. In that application, you have been asked to vouch for that person.

This person believes you can recognize them as an active contributor to the Creative Commons movement. That means you personally know them, you personally know their work and you can say to your peers you support this person be part of the CC Network community.

Vouching someone is not an automatic process, it is an act of trust. When you vouch someone, you are introducing publicly this person in a public way to the CC Community.

What’s next? You can either vouch or decline to vouch for the applicant. You can review their profile and vouch for them (or decline to do so) here:

*|SITE_URL|*/vouch/?applicant_id=*|APPLICANT_ID|*

Please carefully consider:

  • 1. Respond in a timely manner as their application cannot proceed until you do so.
  • 2. At the moment of vouching please be as clear as possible about the reasons you are using to vouch this applicant. Remember this statement may be public on the member's profile.

    • By vouching for an applicant, you consent to Creative Commons sending your personal information to the members of the Interim Membership Council that has final decision making authority with respect to the application. See our Privacy Policy for more information about how we are using your information.

    Creative Commons is an organization committed to the freedom and equality of individuals, no matter their sex, race, color, religion, ancestry, national origin, disability, medical condition, genetic information, age, marital status, sexual orientation, citizenship, primary language, immigration status, or other protected category. Accordingly, you may not take any such factors, or any other factors prohibited by applicable law, in consideration when vouching for or refusing to vouch for an applicant. Similarly, Creative Commons encourages persons to speak up if they in good faith report violations of law. You may not take an applicant's whistleblower activity into consideration in vouching for or refusing to vouch for an applicant.

    Pursuant to the terms of the Privacy Policy, personal information may be collected about you as a voucher, including but not limited to:

    • Name;
    • Email address;
    • Information on how you know the candidate;
    • Country you have identified with or are located;
    • URLs and links to social media; and
    • Any other information that you elect to provide.

    All personal information that you submitted and collected for the purpose of vouching or declining to vouch for an applicant will be deleted within 21 days from the time a decision is made about the applicant (whether positive or negative).

    If you have any questions or concerns about this process, we are happy to help you by email at network-support@creativecommons.org. Or you can always check the updated documentation in our Github page.

    Thank you for your support of the CC Global Network.

    – Creative Commons

    ";}

a:2:{s:7:"subject";s:56:"CC Global Network: Vouching Request Automatically Closed";s:7:"message";s:784:" Vouching Request Automatically Closed

Dear *|VOUCHER_NAME|* –

As you have not already responded to the vouching request from *|APPLICANT_NAME|*, it has been automatically closed.

You can still check the Network website and see the list of any other applications pending your approval:

*Vouching Requests*

Thank you for your support of the CC Global Network.

– Creative Commons

";}

a:2:{s:7:"subject";s:79:"CC Global Network: Please Review *|APPLICANT_NAME|*’s Vouching Request Today!";s:7:"message";s:873:" Please Review *|APPLICANT_NAME|*’s Vouching Request Today!

Dear *|VOUCHER_NAME|* –

This is the last day for you to vouch for *|APPLICANT_NAME|*. To do so, just check the Network website and see the list of applications pending your approval:

*Vouching Requests*

Please respond this request today, otherwise we will consider you are declining the request made from *|APPLICANT_NAME|*

Thank you for your support of the CC Global Network.

– Creative Commons

";}

a:2:{s:7:"subject";s:63:"CC Global Network: *|APPLICANT_NAME|* Is Waiting For Your Vouch";s:7:"message";s:1392:" *|APPLICANT_NAME|* Is Waiting For Your Vouch

Dear *|VOUCHER_NAME|* –

This is a friendly reminder that you have received a vouching request from an applicant for being a member of the CC Global Network.

This person believes you can recognize them as an active contributor to the Creative Commons movement. That means you personally know them, you personally know their work and you can say to your peers you support this person being part of the CC Network community.

Vouching someone is not an automatic process, it is an act of trust. When you vouch someone, you are introducing this person in a public way to the CC Community.

What’s next? Please check the Network website and see the list of applications pending your approval:

Vouching Requests

Please respond in a timely manner as their application cannot proceed until you do so.

Thank you for your support of the CC Global Network.

– Creative Commons

";}

a:2:{s:7:"subject";s:45:"CC Global Network Vouching Request (Reminder)";s:7:"message";s:1313:" Vouching Request Reminder

Dear *|VOUCHER_NAME|* –

This is a friendly reminder that you have a pending application to be vouched.

This person believes you can recognize them as an active contributor to the Creative Commons movement. That means you personally know them, you personally know their work and you can say to your peers you support this person being part of the CC Network community.

Vouching someone is not an automatic process, it is an act of trust. When you vouch someone, you are introducing this person in a public way to the CC Community.

What’s next? Please check the Network website and see the list of applications pending your approval:

*Vouching Requests*

Please respond in a timely manner as their application cannot proceed until you do so.

Thank you for your support of the CC Global Network.

– Creative Commons

";}

a:2:{s:7:"subject";s:78:"CC Global Network: Remember To Review *|APPLICANT_NAME|*’s Vouching Request!";s:7:"message";s:944:" Remember To Review *|APPLICANT_NAME|*’s Vouching Request!

Dear *|VOUCHER_NAME|* –

This is a friendly reminder that you have a pending application request waiting from *|APPLICANT_NAME|* to be vouched. Please check the Network website and see the list of applications pending your approval:

*Vouching Requests*

Please respond in a timeline manner this request, otherwise we will consider you are declining the request made from *|APPLICANT_NAME|*

Thank you again for your support of the CC Global Network.

– Creative Commons

";}

a:2:{s:7:"subject";s:60:"CC Global Network Membership Vouching Request Needs Updating";s:7:"message";s:1610:" A Vouching Request was Declined

Dear *|APPLICANT_NAME|* –

Unfortunately, one of the people you asked to vouch your application has declined to do so. The reasons may vary, but this usually happens when the voucher doesn't personally know you or your work and contributions to the Commons. There are many ways to contribute that don't require membership, and if you're not yet well-known in the community, a good first step before membership is to get involved in a platform or another CC project.

If you have been an active contributor to CC, then you may simply need to select another voucher who knows you and your work. A good idea is to contact them in advance to let them know you're going to ask them to vouch.

You can update your choice of vouchers by following this link:

*|APPLICATION_FORM_URL|*

Once you've chosen a new member to vouch for your membership application, your application will continue.

If you have any questions or concerns about this process, we are happy to help you by email at network-support@creativecommons.org, but we are limited in what we can discuss about your particular application.

– Creative Commons

";}

a:2:{s:7:"subject";s:63:"CC Global Network Membership Application Automatically Declined";s:7:"message";s:1447:" Application Declined

Dear *|APPLICANT_NAME|* –

We regret to have to inform you that your application to join the Creative Commons Global Network has been automatically declined due to you not updating your Vouchers.

Our Privacy Policy provides that you may access and correct any personal information that Creative Commons may have. If you believe that Creative Commons may have incorrect personal information about you, collected either through your application or through the voucher(s), please email Creative Commons at legal@creativecommons.org. Creative Commons will only retain such information for 21 days from the time your application was declined, after which your personal information related to your application will be deleted.

If you have any questions or concerns about this process, we are happy to help you by email at network-support@creativecommons.org, but we are limited in what we can discuss about your particular application.

– Creative Commons

";}

a:2:{s:7:"subject";s:71:"CC Global Network Membership Vouching Request Needs Updating (Reminder)";s:7:"message";s:1715:" A Vouching Request was Declined

Dear *|APPLICANT_NAME|* –

This is a reminder that you need to update your application to join the CC Global Network.

Unfortunately, one of the people you asked to vouch your application has declined to do so. The reasons may vary, but this usually happens when the voucher doesn't personally know you or your work and contributions to the Commons. There are many ways to contribute that don't require membership, and if you're not yet well-known in the community, a good first step before membership is to get involved in a platform or another CC project.

If you have been an active contributor to CC, then you may simply need to select another voucher who knows you and your work. A good idea is to contact them in advance to let them know you're going to ask them to vouch.

You can update your choice of vouchers by following this link:

*|APPLICATION_FORM_URL|*

Once you've chosen a new member to vouch for your membership application, your application will continue.

If you have any questions or concerns about this process, we are happy to help you by email at network-support@creativecommons.org, but we are limited in what we can discuss about your particular application.

– Creative Commons

";}
